subject: Hockey, Ice
Trades (Sports)
lead_paragraph: The Pittsburgh Penguins and the Edmonton Oilers each tried to shore up a weak spot by swapping backup goaltenders, with the Penguins acquiring Mathieu Garon for Dany Sabourin, the minor league forward Ryan Stone and a fourth-round draft pick in 2011. Sabourin, at 28, is three years younger than Garon. Sabourin is 6-8-2 with an .898 save percentage and a 2.85 goals against average. Garon has a 6-8 record, an .895 save percentage and a 3.17 goals against average.
